Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Black Small Plate
Description: A pottery plate made of orange colored clay, it has a black glaze and in some places it has lost its color. It is circular and slightly concave in the center. It is devoid of any drawings or ornamentation. This plate was one of the items used at the table during the Hellenistic era. Serving dishes of the period included plates and bowls, and were used depending on which type of food was being served, whether soup, meats, vegetables or grain.
